title: Computer Science Retraining Laboratory-Based Program for Secondary School Teachers

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic programming and general teaching experience
context.additional_context: Conducted in a blended environment combining laboratory settings with online platforms, including three hours of intensive practical sessions per week

learning_goals: Participants can explain core computer science concepts (algorithms, data structures, programming paradigms) aligned with secondary education standards within four weeks

Participants will create lesson designs for two CS Unplugged activities, one block-based coding tool (e.g., Scratch), and one text-based programming tool (e.g., Python) during a 3-week intermediate course, and demonstrate instructional design competence by scoring 3/4 or higher in peer and instructor rubric evaluations (clarity of objectives, tool appropriateness, activity diversity).
Participants complete instructional design documents incorporating critical thinking elements by reflecting on peer assessment feedback
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
